incidents.name: Service interruption - web app and Flag Delivery Network

incident_updates.body: All systems have recovered and impacted is fully mitigated.

affected_components.name: Flag Delivery Network (core functionality) - Server-side streaming API
Flag Delivery Network (core functionality) - Client-side streaming API
Flag Delivery Network (core functionality) - Polling API
Flag Delivery Network (core functionality) - Edge API

incident_updates.body:
Our systems are actively recovering.

- the LaunchDarkly web application and REST API health has returned to normal
- the Flag Delivery Network has a 2% error rate connecting for new server-side streaming connections, however, our SDKs are configured to retry and retried connections are likely to succeed.
- the Flag Delivery Network's client-side streaming services and polling services have recovered
- the event pipeline has recovered

The team is continuing to monitor, investigate, and respond.

Flag Delivery Network (core functionality) - Edge API

incident_updates.body:
We’re investigating a major outage to LaunchDarkly systems. Currently identified impact includes:

- the LaunchDarkly web application and REST APIs have elevated error rates
- the Flag Delivery Network has elevated error rates for streaming and polling SDK requests
- the event pipeline is dropping a small portion of inbound events

The system is showing possible signs of recovering.

There is no impact to other LaunchDarkly Services.

incidents.name: Increased API latency and error rate

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
System health has remained healthy since our previous update at 8:07 PDT. We're continuing to monitor the system health at this time.

We have identified the issue and made a change that have restored access to the web app and returned the API to normal. We are not yet confident that full problem has been eliminated, however, and we are continuing to investigate.

We are currently investigating increased latency and timeout-related error rates in our REST API.

This will result in slow responses or time-outs when logging in to the web app to create or update flags. The Flag Delivery Network and flag evaluations are unaffected.

components.name: Flag targeting
components.description: UI and APIs used to update flag targeting rules

incidents.name: Increased API latency and error rate

incident_updates.body:
API latency and error rate remain stable and within normal limits. We are resolving this incident but will continue to keep careful watch for any signs of recurrence.

The experimentation pipeline will continue to be delayed for an additional hour or so until it catches up with the backlog.

affected_components.name: Feature management (non-core functionality) - Flag usage metrics

incident_updates.body:
As of 9:15pm PT, we have corrected root cause of the incident and access to the LaunchDarkly website has returned to normal.
We identified a database change that significantly increased load on our main datastore, slowing application responses and making the web application slow or unavailable for most users. The experimentation data pipeline is currently behind schedule, but is catching up and no data has been lost. Also during this time, the flag delivery network experienced increased latency in propagating flag updates, but flag evaluations continued unaffected. 

After identifying the problematic update, we reverted the change and saw system health restored.
We will conduct a post-mortem and can provide more details if requested. If you have further questions please contact support@launchdarkly.com or your account team.

affected_components.name: Feature management (non-core functionality) - Flag usage metrics

incident_updates.body: We are still experiencing high latency in our API leading to increased errors in the API and web application. We are continuing to work to restore normal service.

affected_components.name: Feature management (non-core functionality) - Flag usage metrics

incident_updates.body: We continue to see high latency and timeouts across much of the API. The LD web application is currently unavailable. SDK initializations and flag evaluations are exhibiting higher latency and an increased error rate, but remain within operational bounds. We are continuing our work to mitigate the issue.

incidents.name: Contexts not appearing in the LaunchDarkly Web Application

incident_updates.body: Custom contexts have been enabled for all customers. If you encounter any context-related bugs or issues please reach out to LaunchDarkly Support through your preferred channel or for General Support: https://support.launchdarkly.com/
Contexts Ingestion has been verified for affected customers. Affected customers limited to Users list access will be re-enabled in 4 days on Monday 6 March 2023.
All known Context Indexing errors are fixed. The remaining affected customers continue to have access to their Users list to provide time for more events to populate their Contexts list.

We have re-enabled access to custom contexts for most affected customers. However, we’re continuing to investigate a small number of customers who are still missing contexts. These remaining affected customers continue to have access to their Users list while access to custom contexts is restricted.

We verified the fixes to allow contexts to be received and processed by LaunchDarkly services.

However, affected customers have not yet regained access to custom contexts. We will re-enable their access to custom contexts after we receive and process more events to populate their Contexts list.

We have temporarily disabled support for custom contexts for all affected customers. At this time, affected customers can access user information in the LaunchDarkly web application but cannot yet use new custom context functionality.

Customers not affected by this incident retain access to custom contexts.

We are investigating application issues where Contexts may appear to be missing from the flag targeting page. There is no impact to previously setup Users based targeting or Flag Evaluations.

There is no impact to the SDKs evaluations, or applications using the LaunchDarkly service.
The context indexing pipeline has been caught up as of 00:15 UTC. This incident is now resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. The context indexing pipeline is in the process of processing the backlog.

We have identified an issue with our context indexing pipeline experiencing delays. New contexts will not show up in contexts (formerly users) dashboard. All data will be processed once the pipeline has caught up. No data has been lost.
Feature flag evaluation and updating is unaffected.

components.name: Flag targeting
components.description: UI and APIs used to update flag targeting rules

incident_updates.body: The event processing pipeline is fully caught up and operating normally.
We have deployed the fix and are monitoring the recovery of the pipeline backlog, which should be caught up shortly.

Event processing is currently delayed for and will be showing stale data for: 
Flag Statuses
Flag Insights
Users Dashboard
Auto Completion

No data has been lost and the system should be caught up shortly.

incidents.name: Delayed Context Ingestion for Early Access Customers

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We are investigating a delay with context ingestion. During this time, the flag targeting page will not be updated in real-time with autofill context kinds.

This only affects customers enrolled in the Custom Contexts Early Access Program. (Contexts EAP)

There is no impact to the Users Services, SDKs, or applications using the LaunchDarkly service.

incident_updates.body: The incident has been resolved. New emails sent will contain a valid link.
We are investigating an issue where some account confirmation email links are invalid.

components.name: Account management
components.description: UI and APIs used to manage a LaunchDarkly account

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We are currently investigating this issue. This issue is preventing customers from authorizing new OAuth 2.0 applications such as the Slack App and MS Teams App. Customers who have previously authorized these applications should be unaffected.

incidents.name: Compare Flags page not loading correctly

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The Compare Flags page is now fully functional again. We will continue monitoring but do not anticipate any further problems with this functionality.
We are currently investigating an issue with the Compare Flags page. When selecting environments to compare across the page remains blank.

incidents.name: Delayed Context Ingestion for Early Access Customers

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We are investigating a delay with context ingestion. During this time, the flag targeting page will not be updated in real-time with autofill context kinds.

This only affects customers enrolled in the Custom Contexts Early Access Program. (Contexts EAP)

There is no impact to the Users Services, SDKs, or applications using the LaunchDarkly service.
